newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila approves Aboitiz power project.
newsitem.headline: Manila approves Aboitiz power project.

text.p: Philippine Energy Secretary Francisco Viray said on Monday that state-owned National Power Corp it had approved a $70 million hydro-power plant proposed by a consortium led by Aboitiz Equity Ventures Inc in the northern province of Benguet.

The power company's board decided at a meeting last week to award the contract to the consortium composed of Aboitiz, Northern Mini Hydro Corp, Ever Electrical Corp, and Australia's Pacific Hydro Corp, Viray told reporters.
He said the consortium was the lone qualified bidder on the project.
The proposed 65 to 70-megawatt plant, to be built under the build-operate-transfer scheme, is scheduled to start commercial operation by the year 2000.
